title: What is the sign of charge A

content.description: Three small spheres, A, B, and C, have charges with magnitudes qA, qB, and qC, respectively.The three spheres are aligned along a straight line, as shown in the figure above. At the instant shown, the net force on sphere A is zero.
content.question: Which of the following is true about the sign of charge qA?

choices.label: The sign of charge qA must be the same as that of qB.
The sign of charge qA must be the same as that of qC.
The sign of charge qA must be the same as that of either qB or qC greater magnitude.
The sign of charge qA must be the same as that of either qB or qC lesser magnitude.
It is possible that qA could be either positive or negative.

content.answer: It is possible that qA could be either positive or negative.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
